title: So there is this new game coming out called Overwatch....
body:
I hope they run Riot into the ground by taking a huge chunk of their players, and stopping new players from joining League.

I have never, ever, loathed a game company more than Riot--EA and Bioware come close because of the bullshit they pulled with Mass Effect 3, but that was just a one time FU to their customers.

I feel like Riot hates their customers. THEY NEVER respond to critiques or grievances on here. They never admit they were wrong, or apologized for not listening to everyone when we said...uh hey, those crits on Yasou with the new masteries will be bullshit...or any number of stupid things they do.

And as for Dynamic Queue....I just don't understand why premades arent only matched up with premades. If you are a pre-made of 2, you should be matched in a game against a pre-made of 2 and 3 loners.

What, not enough players for that? Are your numbers BS Riot? I though you had like 67 Bazillion players.

Amateurs, riding the gravy train of being int he right place at the right time, much like that facebook nerd who will never ever do anything else in life, because he is a one trick pony....hes not creative, or some visionary, he just capitalized on trends at the right time.

Your bosses at Rito are probably the same---just barely above intelligent people who have let their success go to their head. Who cares what the community wants! WE WILL GIVE THEM WHAT WE THINK THEY NEED.

You see Riot...it really is OUR game because, when the customers go, you won't have a game that anyone plays. If you think this silly top down 2D made to look 3D game where everyone runs around crazy hating each other will survive against bigger and better games from companies that give a damn about their customers, you are so very sadly mistaken.

God, I hate Riot so much.

Go cry in somewhere else.  Honestly people like you are why gaming companies take community feedback with piles of salt.  

Lets start with overwatch.  The game is pretty fun and enjoyable but its a completely different genre.  Its way more likely to take players from tf2 (which has been uncontested in its genre for years and years) than it is from league.  

On to the complaint about riot not interacting with the community and their general fuck ups.  These complaints are always so fucking annoying to deal with because it blends item and champion balance fuck ups (like league of cleavers or release xin) with the rework fuck ups (like cassiopeia) and the communication fuck ups (like the solo que promise).  These three are all different teams and have all fucked up at different times.

Lets start with balance fuck ups.  Most of the time these have only happened during the preseason (which gives them a certain amount of leeway to fuck up) and the times when it hasn't been in the preseason they still get around to balancing it eventually.  I'll admit sometimes it takes a while but eventually they find the right spot. 

Rework fuck ups are a bit weird because on the one hand we have a large number of great reworks and VU over the years (Darius, Shen, Poppy, Taric, Fiora, Sion, Trundle, and I would say karma but others might disagree on that one) and some bad ones.  Ryze has always been a problem and IMO his core mechanic of bursty spell caster will never be balanced for league (hence why he is on his third rework),  Cass has gone through two but I think she finally has a good place, Morderkaiser's whole idea (kinda like ryze) just doesn't work in the style of league either hence his many problems.

Communication fuck ups have happened but compared to a lot of companies they listen to their player base.  They have had multiple amas for skarner and cass,  lots of riot ask questions and generally communicate their decisions pretty well.  Their last mistake of solo que was simply a miscommunication.  If they hadn't promised it coming out then there would have been way less backlash.

I just don't see it. They make changes that they supposedly test in PBE and ya know, think out, and then immediately everyone on here calls it as a stupid change...and then Riot has to roll it back months later.

Its just been too many times where they make obvioulsy stupid changes and its apparent to everyone but Riot apparently.

It makes me question their competence. But more realistically, they have bad leadership in their company that stifles good ideas, good analysis, in favor of pushing an agenda or change that a higher up insists on making.
